snippet: Many of his closest supporters have long cautioned that his most headline-grabbing proposals should not be taken literally — they are guideposts, not plans....
abstract: World is about to find out whether Donald Trump will follow through on statements he has made while running for president; while Trump has displayed view that world is zero-sum place, he has also revealed himself as ultimate pragmatist, often willing to dispense with apparent core beliefs to secure for himself negotiating advantage.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, MAGGIE HABERMAN and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger and Binyamin Appelbaum reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.

lead_paragraph: Many of his closest supporters have long cautioned that his most headline-grabbing proposals should not be taken literally — they are guideposts, not plans.

headline.main: World Is About to Find Out What Donald Trump Really Believes
headline.print_headline: Having Heard the Talk, World Awaits Action
